numbered_ace_sentences: 1. In most countries, more people who are 15-24 years old believe that the world is getting better with each generation than people who are at least 40 years old.
2. I find this interesting.
3. I find this predictable.
4. Some countries are on the top-left side of the line.
5. These countries have a positive residual.
6. In these countries, the percentage of younger adults who believe that the world is getting better is higher than the percentage of older adults who believe that the world is getting better.
7. Some countries are on the bottom-right side of the line.
8. These countries have a negative residual.
9. In these countries, the percentage of older adults who believe that the world is getting better is higher than the percentage of younger adults who believe that the world is getting better.
10. Many young adults are progressive.
11. Many older adults are conservative.
12. Older people do not believe that the world is improving.
13. I wonder how these statistics will change over time.
14. Younger adults will become older adults over time.
15. Each generation builds new concepts.
16. People who are older than the latest generation have a hard time understanding how the world is changing.
17. If a person has a hard time understanding how the world is changing then the person does not want the world to change.
18. It is important to remember this.
19. We must ensure that the world continues to get better.
20. We must ensure that all generations can be excited about these changes.
21. We must ensure that all generations can be confident about these changes.
